ai-ud1.2:1.2_0: At one time, when he was first awakened, the Buddha was staying near Uruvelā at the root of a Bodhi tree on the bank of the river Nerañjara at the foot of a Bodhi tree.
ai-ud1.2:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting cross-legged for seven days without moving, experiencing the bliss of freedom.
ai-ud1.2:1.4_0: When seven days had passed, the Buddha emerged from that state of immersion. In the second part of the night, he reflected on dependent origination in reverse order:
ai-ud1.2:2.1_0: “When this doesn’t exist, that is not; due to the cessation of this, that ceases. That is:
ai-ud1.2:2.2_0: And this is the cessation of this, that is:
ai-ud1.2:2.5_0: When consciousness ceases name and form cease,
ai-ud1.2:2.7_0: When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases.
ai-ud1.2:2.11_0: when grasping ceases, continued existence ceases.
ai-ud1.2:2.12_0: When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases.
ai-ud1.2:2.13_0: When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.
ai-ud1.2:2.14_0: This is how there is the end of this whole mass of suffering.”
ai-ud1.2:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.2:4.4_0: since he’s known the end of conditions.”
